title: 114_hr475
content: The "GI Bill Processing Improvement Act of 2015" aims to enhance the information technology of the Veterans Benefits Administration within the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to improve the information technology system to process educational assistance claims electronically and with minimal human intervention. A report on these changes must be submitted to Congress within 180 days. Authorization of appropriations is also included. Authorization of $30,000,000 to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for fiscal years 2015 and 2016 to improve information technology system for processing educational assistance claims. SEC. 3 amends the effective date for approval of courses of education provided by public institutions of higher learning for veterans. SEC. 4 recodifies and improves the election process for post-9/11 educational assistance program. The new section "Sec. 3326. Election to receive educational assistance" allows individuals to elect to receive educational assistance under certain conditions, including retaining unused entitlement under specific chapters. The new section "Sec. 3326. Election to receive educational assistance" allows individuals to elect to receive educational assistance under specific conditions, including retaining unused entitlement under certain chapters of title 10 for members of the Armed Forces. The new section "Sec. 3326. Election to receive educational assistance" allows individuals meeting specific requirements to receive educational assistance and cease contributions towards the GI Bill. Individuals can also revoke transferred entitlement under certain conditions. Individuals who have transferred their entitlement to basic educational assistance under section 3020 of this title can choose to revoke any unused portion. The revoked entitlement will no longer be available to the dependent but can be used by the individual for educational assistance under chapter 33 of this title. Any unrevoked entitlement will remain available to the dependent. Individuals who transfer their entitlement to educational assistance under section 3020 of this title can choose to revoke any unused portion. The revoked entitlement will no longer be available to the dependent but can be used by the individual for educational assistance under chapter 33 of this title. Any unrevoked entitlement will remain available to the dependent. Those making an election under subsection (a) are entitled to educational assistance under this chapter instead of other chapters as applicable. The individual's entitlement to educational assistance under chapter 33 is determined by the unused entitlement from chapter 30 and any entitlement revoked by the individual. Continuing entitlement to educational assistance not available under the 9/11 Assistance Program is addressed for individuals making an election under subsection (a). The individual's entitlement to educational assistance under chapter 33 is determined by the unused entitlement from chapter 30 and any entitlement revoked by the individual. The utilization of entitlement under paragraph (1) shall be chargeable against the individual's entitlement to educational assistance under this chapter. Additional Post-9/11 Assistance is available for members who have made contributions toward the GI Bill. Additional Post-9/11 Assistance is provided to individuals who have made contributions towards the GI Bill, increasing the monthly stipend payable under chapter 33 by the total amount of contributions made under section 3011(b) or 3012(c) of this title. The formula for calculating Additional Post-9/11 Assistance involves multiplying the total contributions made under section 3011(b) or 3012(c) of this title by a fraction representing the remaining entitlement to basic educational assistance under chapter 30, with the denominator being 36 months. The remaining entitlement for individuals covered by certain provisions is 36 months. Payments are made together with the last monthly stipend before exhausting educational assistance entitlement. Individuals entitled to increased educational assistance or supplemental educational assistance under specific sections shall retain that entitlement when utilizing educational assistance under this chapter. The Secretary may provide an alternative election for certain individuals. The Secretary may make an alternative election on behalf of an individual if their submitted election is against their best interests. The individual will be notified within seven days of this decision and given a 30-day period to modify or revoke the election. The Secretary may make an alternative election on behalf of an individual if their submitted election is against their best interests. The individual will be notified with a clear statement of the reasons for the alternative election, and it is irrevocable once made. The subsection (c) of section 5003 of the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2008 is repealed. Additionally, centralized reporting of veteran enrollment by certain groups, districts, and consortiums of educational institutions is required. Section 3684(a) of title 38, United States Code is amended to include a definition of "educational institution" that allows for centralized reporting of enrollments in groups or consortiums of separately accredited institutions in the same State. These amendments apply to reports submitted after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, information regarding veteran entitlement to educational assistance is to be provided. The new section 3699 of title 38, United States Code requires the Secretary to provide educational institutions with information about the amount of educational assistance entitled to veterans or individuals pursuing approved courses under chapters 30, 32, 33, or 35. This information must be regularly updated on an Internet website. (b) Clerical Amendment.--Insert new item after section 3698 in the table of sections at the beginning of the chapter. Provision of certain information to educational institutions.
